message:
I'll consider writing more about memory mapped files as I explore them in [this project](https://github.com/StephenCleary/ArcDb).

I'm wary of parallel processing; memory mapped files are data that _appears_ to be in-memory but can trigger blocking I/O on any read. Parallel processing would cause multiple threads blocked on I/O, and disk I/O tends not to parallelize well to begin with.

> like a csv parser for example

I am aware of the one billion row challenge, but I'm not participating due to lack of time.
